payload.name: abductive
payload.core: Inference to the best explanation: generate hypotheses that would make observations unsurprising, then rank by scope, simplicity, coherence, testability, and mechanism. Introduces novel theoretical entities not directly observed.

out.d: anomalous or surprising facts requiring explanation
top hypothesis with explicit criteria scoring

proc: isolate explanandum: state observations without interpretation
generate >=3 hypotheses: include mundane and structural options
rank by explanatory power: score scope, simplicity, coherence, testability, mechanism (1-3 each)
derive test predictions: observations distinguishing top hypotheses
state confidence and next steps: label as candidate, specify tests needed
check: best explanation selected with explicit scores
labeled candidate explanation not confirmed cause

diff.inductive: posits hidden causes vs generalizes patterns from instances
diff.deductive: introduces new content vs preserves truth in premises
diff.diagnostic: novel/unstructured problems vs structured fault models
diff.causal-inference: generates hypotheses vs tests and quantifies causal claims
diff.case-based: novel hypotheses vs retrieves known explanations

signals: chose most narratively compelling vs best-supported
explanation vivid or has clear villain

use: incident triage and root cause analysis

ex.sit: Production DB latency spikes daily at 2:47 PM, no deployment or traffic spike.
steps: explanandum: 10x latency at 2:47 PM +/-2 min, consistent timing
hypotheses: (a) cron job I/O, (b) backup process, (c) index rebuild, (d) retry storms
scoring: backup=12/15 (best scope, simplicity, coherence, testability, mechanism)
predictions: backup->disk I/O spike; cron->CPU spike; check both
confidence: moderate for backup, revise if I/O normal, next: monitor disk
ex.insight: backup hypothesis confirmed via I/O monitoring; moved to 3 AM
